Posts.Content: Jan 21, 2013 05:04PM rhodeeho wrote: Spiritdeep, my experience is similar to what everyone else has said, BUT my biopsy was scheduled only 2 days after my US, so they just asked me if I had taken any nsaids in the last week (I hadn't).  I put my multi vitamin on the Rx sheet, but no one said a word to me.   I had an appt with breast surgeon first, then biopsy.  Both appointments took almost 3 hours - including another mammo after the biopsy to check the location of the clip they placed in my breast (it wasn't as compressing as the first two I had). I don't really know how they characterize high risk other than the BIRADS score that the radiologist assigns. Try to keep yourself busy and GOOD LUCK!
Posts.Title: Instructions for a core biopsy spiritdeep rhodeeho

Posts.Content: rhodeeho wrote: Hi everyone, thanks for all the words of encouragement over the weekend.  My BS called early this afternoon (literally 24 business hours after my biopsy) to tell me the good news!  The mass in my breast is a non-cancerous tumor - fibroadenoma.  Plan is to repeat US in 6 months and meet with BS again.  If no change is size or shape, I will return to normal annual screenings.  If anything changes, the BS said we will discuss removal via a lumpectomy (she said even though it is non cancerous the most conversative approach is to remove any tumor in the breast that has active cells - which is why they look for changes in size or shape). The last 10 days have been the scariest of my life, but I also learned a lot.  I will NEVER underestimate the importance of regular screening, and I found a very helpful place with lots of caring people who are willing to support complete strangers.  I thank you all for everything - I couldn't have gotten through the last several days without you (((thank you!!!))). Posts.Title: Results are in - BENIGN! rhodeeho brittany12
